info.author: Savithru Lokanath
info.description:
- An asynchronous web-application to fetch current physical location & display it on Google Maps
- Provides relevant location data such as latitude, longitude, zip code for a given physical address
- Capable of resolving keywords, "Eg. Statue of Liberty" into address coordinates & zip code
- REST API that currently provides address-to-coordinate-mapping
- Asynchronous I/O to ensure multiple REST calls are answered (outformat JSON/XML)
- Used Google Maps, Google Geolocation, Google Geocoding, Custom APIs to build the application
- Runs on Tornado & Flask web-framework
- Virtual Environment to build Python 3.4 sandbox 
- HTTP load testing using Apache Benchmarking tool

Beta-Tested (More features coming soon)
info.name: LocationWebApp
info.summary: API to show your current location on a Google Map & to obtain location data such as latitude, longitude, zip-code & much more
info.html_description:
• An asynchronous web-application to fetch current physical location & display it on Google Maps
  • Provides relevant location data such as latitude, longitude, zip code for a given physical address
  • Capable of resolving keywords, “Eg. Statue of Liberty” into address coordinates & zip code
  • REST API that currently provides address-to-coordinate-mapping
  • Asynchronous I/O to ensure multiple REST calls are answered (outformat JSON/XML)
  • Used Google Maps, Google Geolocation, Google Geocoding, Custom APIs to build the application
  • Runs on Tornado & Flask web-framework
  • Virtual Environment to build Python 3.4 sandbox
  • HTTP load testing using Apache Benchmarking tool

Beta-Tested (More features coming soon)
